title: European Highroof campout 27/28/29 June '14 + pre 67 bus!

posts.content:
Right.. need to blow some dust of this topic..

Are we still coming down? I heard from some people they can't and other they want to come so will post a paypal address soon for those who come to make a £5 deposit.
I'm not a fan of asking this at all but I need to know how many are coming for sure with regards to toilet and food.. plse remember, this is a no profit event!!
Cheers
Im certainly comming
just to check though it is thursday,friday and saturday?

Hey buddy,

Sorry for the late reply..
It's Friday - Saturday - Sunday

See you soon!!

I've had confirmation of the below highroofs

- 1. Stephan ('65) UK
- 2. Stephan ('63) UK
- 3. 211vanman (67) UK
- 4. eastcoastslammer (64) UK
- 5. hightop lee (
- 6. Matt (67) UK
- 7. Stuart (67) UK

Cancelled

Crewcab66 - bus still undergoing resto
Nickoo - bus for sale




Jason, Dee are you still coming down?


The location is Paley street - maidenhead!
cool so hope its not wet ;-0

I'm afraid I'm out , was looking forward to this as well !
Brickend gone through scoop and radiator and don't think will be fixed in time ,
Hope everyone's has a good time, if I do manage to get it back on road will drop a line

Cheers dave

Goulash wrote:I'm afraid I'm out , was looking forward to this as well !
Brickend gone through scoop and radiator and don't think will be fixed in time ,
Hope everyone's has a good time, if I do manage to get it back on road will drop a line

Cheers dave


Sorry to hear of your bus troubles, would be cool if you could get it sorted if not we'll see you another time..

Thanks

2 weeks!!

All is booked and the fields are looking good as ever..




Even the sheep, ducks and chicks are ready for you


Don't forget there won't be any traders but if you'd like to sell some old stuff you can have a small patch in front of your bus for 1 symbolic £ .
Unfortunately we haven't managed to get a deal done with the local airfield for a vintage photoshoot due to safety restrictions.
Hopefully the weather will be on our side!!

See you in 2 weeks!
Looks great mate what a nice little spot

An update for upcoming weekend!


Gates open

-Friday lunch time - 8pm
-Saturday 9am - 8pm
-Sunday 9 am-3 pm / end @ 5pm

(After gate closure, you'll still be able to enter if you give me a buzz on my mobile not at silly 'o clock)


Food:
Friday eve, bring your own.
Saturday eve, a venison is ring on the spit and will be served with salads, bread etc (included in the entrance price)


Please note:
-Dogs are allowed but must be kept on a lead at all times (there's sheep, goose and chickens on the farm) and nr2's need to be cleaned up immediately!
-Other vehicles can be parked safely on a different field!!
-Toilets will be available as a water tap but no electric hook up's.
-Litter goes in provided bins. (agriculture field - keep clean plse!!)
-Autojumble is allowed to a max of 3 sq/m per vehicle and we'll ask a economical £1 fee
-BBQ's are ok but must be kept off the ground, no open fires!






The first high roofs are already waiting!!





.. … in the weeds ..






Address: Paley street - Maidenhead - SL6 3JN


How to get there:

Via M4

- At junction 8/9, take the A404(M)/A308(M) exit to High Wycombe/Henley/Maidenhead
- At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto A308(M) heading to Maidenhead (Central)
Take A330 to B3024
- At the roundabout, take the 4th exit onto Ascot Rd/A330
Continue to follow A330
- After 2 miles go right onto B3024 (Paley street)
- Whites farm on the right after approx. 0.6 miles

Via M3

- At Junction 3, take A322 to Bagshot Rd/A3095/Bracknell
Go through 3 roundabouts.
- At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto Bagshot Rd/A3095
- Continue on A3095. Take A330 to B3024 in Windsor and Maidenhead
- Exit the roundabout onto Bagshot Rd/A3095
- At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto Church Rd
- At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto Warfield Rd/A3095
Continue to follow A3095
Go through 1 roundabout
- Turn left onto Warfield St/A3095
Continue to follow A3095
- Turn right onto Maidenhead Rd/A3095
- Turn left toward A330
- Turn left onto A330
Go through 1 roundabout
- Sharp left onto B3024/ Paley street
- Whites farm on the right after approx. 0.6 miles

Via M40

- At junction 4, take the A404 exit to High Wycombe/Marlow
- Take the A4 exit toward Reading/Maidenhead
- Take Cannon Ln and Waltham Rd to B3024
- At the roundabout, take the 1st exit onto the A4 ramp to Maidenhead
- At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto Cannon Ln
Go through 1 roundabout
- At the roundabout, take the 2nd exit onto Waltham Rd
Go through 1 roundabout
- Turn left onto Church Hill (towards Paley street_
- Continue onto Littlefield Green/B30/ Paley street
- Whites farm on the left after approx. 1 miles

Follow these signs


Price: £15 for the weekend/adult (kids are free)

Well done all involved, this was a perfect little camp out! Good to meet old friends, and make a few new ones.
